page.title: 16Farming in the Wolfords
page.content: This block is nearly all farmland on good but heavy soil. There are several milking herds, beef cattle a flock of sheep and two pig units. Poultry are only kept on a domestic scale. The main arable crops are barley and wheat with a small acreage this year of oil seed rape and oats. Two farmers grow potatoes. A small amount of Maize was grown as a 'pick your own' crop. Kale was grown as a fodder crop for cattle and also a few acres of feed peas. Grass is fairly intensively cultivated both for grazing and for winter keep - the cattle live on silage and hay when they are in for the winter. The sheep are kept out but given extra hay and concentrates. They are lambed inside in March and April. There is one large farm employing 9 men, the other farms are mainly run by the families.
